mangan

Class Simulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • mangan.Simulator

  • public class Simulator
extends java.lang.Object
    Main class coordinating the evolution of the steps taken by the robots while interacting with them in order to provide the data they are allowed to know by the requirements, in the way they are supposed to. A HashMaps keeps all the info from every robot (what it can know) and another one the coordinates and speed (which it can't know) and manages this data to give it to the robots in the appropiate way. The weights to each moving algorithm can be previously modified and are given to the robots before deployment (as in real life) It tracks the mangan in the whole sea to know how many is collected by each robot (and in total) Countdown is the maximum of iterations (steps, seconds) the robots can be moving around until they change to gathering mode. InitialAttempts is the number iterations any robot is moving faster than a threshold (so they are all stuck) until they automatically switch to gathering mode.

      For a given input, loop over all the possible configurations and iterations before automatic gathering when all robots are stuck to find the best parameter values to collect the maximum amount of mangan.

      • getNeighbors

        public static java.util.List<Coordinates> getNeighbors(Coordinates rob,
                                                       int key)
        Given one robot, checks which robots are within the RADIUS distance and keeps the list of coordinates neighbors, with the relative positions of those respect the robot checked, so the information is able to be sent to the robot as if it was its own radar.
        Parameters:
        rob - the robots coordinates we want the neighbors for.
        key - key of the robot as index value to find the correct one.
        Returns:
        a list with coordinates of all the neighbors.

        Set the deployment algorithm by changing the DeploymentContext at runtime thanks to strategy pattern.
        Parameters:
        choice - an integer to reflect the corresponding deployment algorithm.

      • neighborDiscovery

        public static boolean neighborDiscovery(int x,
                                        int y)
                                 throws RobotHasNoNeighborException
        Checks a certain position for potential neighbors. Throws exception, if no robot is found.
        Parameters:
        x - the x value to check.
        y - the y value to check.
        Returns:
        true if robots are available, false if not.
        Throws:
        RobotHasNoNeighborException - in case no robot is near this coordinate.
